snippet: The United Nations human rights office released a report implicating Chadian members of the African peacekeeping mission in attacks on civilians.
abstract: United Nations human rights office warns that violence may return to Bangui, Central African Republic, following easing of clashes between Muslim rebels and Christian groups, warning that situation remains volatile.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations human rights office released a report implicating Chadian members of the African peacekeeping mission in attacks on civilians.

headline.main: Central African Republic Violence Ebbs, but U.N. Warns of Flare-Up
headline.print_headline: Central African Republic: Capital Is Calm but Volatile, U.N. Says
